article_title: How to throw a summer blow-out on a budget
article_text:
How to throw a summer blow-out on a budget

Photo: ONLINE_YES Houstonian Will Matthews has released an event-planning book.

Do event planners hold the secrets to a happy life? Houstonian Will Matthews thinks so. Matthews discovered a passion for planning events when he threw his own high school graduation party and has been planning functions large and small on and off ever since. Six years ago, he launched RSVP With Will and has planned corporate events for clients including the University of Houston and the United Way.

article_metadata.description: Matthews discovered a passion for planning events when he threw his own high school graduation party and has been planning functions large and small on and off ever since.  Six years ago, he launched RSVP With Will and has planned corporate events for clients including the University of Houston and the United Way.  [...] Matthews has a new book offering advice for parties and more, titled "Everything I Needed to Know About Life I Learned from an Event Planner."  In advance of the book's launch party at Triniti restaurant on Monday, June 2, Matthews shared some of his favorite tips for hosting a memorable and affordable summer shindig at home.  Raise your glass: The quickest way to create a tone for the evening is to offer guests a drink as soon as they get there or when they sit down, whether it's beer, wine, a cocktail, coffee or even water.
article_metadata.author.name: By Sarah Rufca
